alert.note: Alert for Lee; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 12:50PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Randolph, northern Lee and northern Terrell Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1250 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Plains to 9 miles south of Lumpkin. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Leesburg, Smithville, Bronwood, Parrott, Chokee, Jordan Place, Yeomans, Starksville, Scrutchins, Oakville, Chambliss, Olivers Mill, Neyami, Brooksville, Benevolence and Mossy Dell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
